x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Over 60% of urban workers in Africa operate in the informal sector without access to credit or banking services. Traders often lack formal records, making it difficult for financial institutions to assess their reliability. This results in lost opportunities, poor business growth, and continued financial exclusion.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Built on ServiceNow’s Customer Service and Risk Management platforms:

CSM for trader onboarding, support, and verification.

Flow Designer to automate credit scoring workflows.

IntegrationHub for linking with fintech APIs and mobile payment systems.

GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) to manage credit risk and identity validation.

Performance Analytics to track loan repayment trends and trader growth.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • API connections to microfinance institutions and mobile money platforms.
  • Cloud database for transaction and reputation data.
  • SMS/USSD support for traders without smartphones.
  • Secure digital ID verification tools (e.g., NIN or Aadhaar integration).

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Key challenges include trust and adoption among informal traders, compliance with KYC/data laws, and ensuring fair and bias-free credit scoring models. Continuous training and local partnerships will be needed to scale effectively.
